I'm a [Computational Scientist](https://alcf.anl.gov/about/people/sam-foreman)
in the [AI / ML group](https://www.alcf.anl.gov/about/people/group/506)
at the [Argonne Leadership Computing Facility (ALCF)](https://www.alcf.anl.gov/).

I'm generally interested in the large scale distributed training of AI models
for scientific applications, and am the co-lead of the 
[Models / Pre-Training group](https://auroragpt.anl.gov/about/#teams)
for the [AuroraGPT](https://auroragpt.anl.gov) project.

Prior to this, I received my PhD in Physics from the University of Iowa in
2019, where I used ML to build better Markov Chain Monte Carlo sampling
techniques for Lattice Quantum Chromodynamics
([`l2hmc-qcd`](https://github.com/saforem2/l2hmc-qcd)).
